general.author: Christy
general.text: Our NYT article just got published, check it out here: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/03/09/us/teacher-tech-boom.html

general.author: John
general.text: Whoever keeps leaving dirty dishes in the sink, the sponge is there for a reason…

general.author: Anna
general.text: The elevator isn’t going down when you press the button :sadpanda:

general.author: David
general.text: @christy

general.author: Christy
general.text: The building manager says he won’t be able to get a contractor in until Monday. @here Please use the stairs instead!

general.author: David
general.text: New building soon!

general.author: Christy
general.text: #newbuildingnewproblems

general.author: Christy
general.text: The 2018 Q1 workplace survey is here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfGKplxG2FmtyaWW906yO1lvaZ4BKIDkkurAW9fHaG Please fill it out by next Friday!

general.author: John
general.text: This dish situation is getting out of hand. You know some of us need our coffee in the morning, and I can’t fill up the boiler with this pile of crap in the sink.

general.author: Christy
general.text: Food incoming in 5 minutes!

general.author: Christy
general.text: Can someone help me bring up the food?

general.author: David
general.text: When will the localizations into Russian be finished? I’m getting more than a few concerned emails.

general.author: John
general.text: Browser language = ru represents less than 1% of our users

general.author: David
general.text: It’s our third largest cohort, put pressure on the translators

general.author: Christy
general.text: Elevator technician is here! Please excuse the noise for the next hour.

general.author: John
general.text: Oh god, when will it stop?

general.author: Christy
general.text: I’ve closed the front door, but I’ve been informed that there is no quiet way to do it.

general.author: Christy
general.text: The repair is finished!

general.author: John
general.text: Can we jump in it?

general.author: Christy
general.text: Please no…

general.author: Anna
general.text: I’m so excited about axe throwing! I’ve always wanted to do it! Thanks Christy!

general.author: Christy
general.text: Aww thanks!

general.author: Christy
general.text: Lunch incoming! And we will be having cake afterwards to celebrate March birthdays!

general.author: Ajay
general.text: @christy would you happen to have the contact info for Brad Gutenberg? He’s a contractor

general.author: Christy
general.text: @ajay I can’t find that name in upwork, do you know if they were last active before June last year? We switched systems then

general.author: Ajay
general.text: It seems like they committed recently, I’ll look into it more

general.author: Christy
general.text: @here Everyone look through your guru cards and any google products for edits from a “Brad Gutenberg”. It appears that an account was illicitly added to our org and they may have changed some of our docs

general.author: John
general.text: Is this the same account that we are looking for in github? They hacked google and github? Scary

general.author: Christy
general.text: Thanks @ajay for bringing this to our attention

general.author: David
general.text: We just closed the Pearson deal! Thanks to everyone who made this possible over the last few months!

general.author: Anna
general.text: @christy I’m not anywhere close to finished with looking through my emails because of the code audit, but from doing a quick search it seems like many many emails have been inserted into my inbox that reference brad or are from brad. I don’t know why they are here, it’s like they are trying to convince us he works here.

general.author: John
general.text: Maybe that’s the plan, it might have worked if we were a bigger company, but it’s hard to believe this is their endgame if they have access to all of our github and google accounts.

general.author: Christy
general.text: You may have noticed the desk at the front of the office labeled “Brad” in the seating chart. Please don’t touch anything on it, we are having the police come in later today to look at it.

general.author: David
general.text: @here Meeting at the couches now

general.author: Christy
general.text: @here Let me know if you think anything is missing from your desk.

general.author: Ajay
general.text: @here Theres a person here from steel city locksmiths, does anyone know anything about that?

general.author: David
general.text: They said that “Christy” scheduled an appointment to change the locks on the front and back doors. @here look through your emails for this person

general.author: Anna
general.text: I can tell you right now that the issue is a lot bigger than we thought. There are a ton of emails in my inbox from christy, and theres a lot from brad as well. It looks like this goes a lot further than just github

general.author: John
general.text: I’m seeing the same thing, emails from brad and christy. How did they get into github AND google!?

general.author: Anna
general.text: I don’t know about anyone else, but I’m seeing emails that are from me that I definitely didn’t send. This seems to be way bigger than just someone added to our org

general.author: David
general.text: This is too much this morning, I say we officially break for early lunch. Where to?

general.author: John
general.text: Elbow room!

general.author: Anna
general.text: To the elevator!

general.author: David
general.text: I’ll be on the phone with customer support all day at this rate

general.author: David
general.text: Theres another suspicious desk in the office, stay away from the first desk to the left of the door.

general.author: John
general.text: How did we miss this when the police were here?

general.author: John
general.text: I think ill work from home for the rest of the day. I’ve got a splitting headache from that undercooked pasta

general.author: David
general.text: I’ve printed up our org chart and taped it to the pillar. Let me know if theres anyone on here you don’t recognize besides christy and brad.

general.author: John
general.text: @here I’ve put a bunch of things on the table next to the couches. Let me know if theres anything you recognize

general.author: Anna
general.text: @john this keyboard definitely used to be mine, where did you find this stuff?

general.author: John
general.text: Not feeling well again, I think ill work from home.

general.author: David
general.text: I’m having pizza brought in, what toppings does everyone want?

general.author: Anna
general.text: pepperoni and cheese!

general.author: David
general.text: @here I’ll be working from home for the rest of the week tracking down these issues we’ve been having. I don’t know about my connectivity tomorrow and day after, but I should be reachable by friday

general.author: Ajay
general.text: What’s happening for lunch today?

general.author: Anna
general.text: Want to get Mercurio’s at noon?

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: Remember to let me know before 5PM if you want to go to Google I/O this year.

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Triggered #6476 | Problem | Disaster | No space left on volume /! Assigned: Brad Guttenberg Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Acknowledged #6476 | Problem | Disaster | No space left on volume /! Assigned: Brad Guttenberg Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Triggered #6477 | Problem | Disaster | No space left on volume /! Assigned: Brad Guttenberg Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Acknowledged #6477 | Problem | Disaster | No space left on volume /! Assigned: Brad Guttenberg Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Resolved #6477 | Problem | Disaster | No space left on volume /! Assigned: Brad Guttenberg Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Resolved #6476 | Problem | Disaster | No space left on volume /! Assigned: Brad Guttenberg Service: Monolith

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: The diagnostics site is up! You can go to graderite.com/diagnostics to see user statistics, emulate users, and more! Make sure you are logged in to your admin accounts.

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: This tool is amazing! Thanks John!

engineering.author: Brad
engineering.text: I’ll be out of cell range all weekend while I’m hiking Allegheny National Forest. John is on call and should be next point of contact for anything going wrong with monolith.

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Triggered #6478 | Problem | Disaster | Average CPUUtilization GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 80.0 for ServiceName graderite-portal-worker-prod! Assigned: Brad Guttenberg Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Acknowledged #6478 | Problem | Disaster | Average CPUUtilization GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold... Assigned: Brad Guttenberg Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Resolved #6478 | Problem | Disaster | Average CPUUtilization GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold... Assigned: Brad Guttenberg Service: Monolith

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: Oh god, don’t leave us!

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: I’m sure nothing will happen…

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: People are reporting 404’s on the overview page. Are we sure the credentials issue is fixed?

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: ^ @here

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: Rollbar is showing a spike in JS errors, looking like a routing issue, @John?

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: Looking into it!

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Triggered #6479 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: John Lovington Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Acknowledged #6479 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: John Lovington Service: Monolith

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: @here whats going on?

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: It looks like it’s a temporary spike, queue length going down again

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Acknowledged #6479 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: John Lovington Service: Monolith

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: I’ll have Brad look into it on Monday

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: I just noticed a bot unassigned my PR’s reviewer. What is going on?

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: After commenting, the graderite bot unassigns the reviewer so the owner can address the issue

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: When did this start? And is it referenced anywhere?

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: Last week, it’s in the guru card: https://app.getguru.com/#/facts/38beb0ba-a0ec-4cdd-81df-4c7f34a44e07

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: Here’s your periodic reminder that GDPR begins in May. Make sure you are following all the steps in this card for your owned repos: https://app.getguru.com/#/facts/5e90af78-41e1-42a2-8a5c-491c92b83c2d

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: Can anyone explain what this spike is on March 3? https://metrics.graderite.com/segmentation#aggregation:(type:unique),analysis:linear,chartType:line,dateEnd:'0',dateStart:'12',eventName:welcome,timeUnit:day

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: This seems to correspond with a spike in forum posts, which matches with the “sexy local schoolteacher” problem.

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: Bots?

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: Looks like it.

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: We’ve identified that the localization backend is costing us a lot for the amount of work it should be doing. I’ve written up a preliminary spec about transferring it over to Scala, please take a look: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mJnOx5koOATe8MhQ1Ni2m2aK-g7QnZZlkNyYqJtAFws/edit?usp=sharing

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Triggered #6480 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: John Lovington Service: Monolith

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: @john is this the same problem from the weekend?

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Acknowledged #6480 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: John Lovington Service: Monolith

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: It looks like it. Keeping an eye on the queue

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: Is this user facing?

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: Users won’t notice this latency, it’s just for notifications

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: It’s going down again.

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Resolved #6480 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: John Lovington Service: Monolith

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: @john Did you find anything about the queue

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: Thanks to @anna and @ajay I was able to find that the scaling policy wasn’t set up correctly to deal with our newly increased user base. I increased the max machines

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: Is anyone on top of periodically reviewing things like this as our DAUs grow?

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: Not atm, @ajay?

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: Sure

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: I’m trying to merge in my big transfer change, but the jenkins ci task is failing. Who would I ask about that kind of thing?

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: @here It looks like the load on the reports db is spiking, does anyone know of something that may be querying it? Welcomes are steady

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: Looks like a runaway query in the diagnostics dashboard. I’ve shut down the dashboard for now until I push the fix.

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: Would it be possible to force-merge this change since the jenkins is failing?

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: I think we should wait until we get the ci back up. Do you need help?

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: Where would I look for mapping between github usernames and employee names?

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: There’s already a card in guru for this.

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: Who would have the contractor contact information?

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: Christy would

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: @here Some of our accounts might have been hacked, including our github. We need each of the platform owners to look through the commits by `bgutenberg` to find out what they changed.

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: Is this the same account on guru and google? How did this happen?!?

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: @here engineering meeting today cancelled

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: The jenkins ci has been fixed! Thanks @anna! You can now retrigger your ci by commenting `run ci` in your pr

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: Would any repo checkers be free to give the final check on my transfer pr? #56

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: @here How long will it take to revert all of these fake commits?

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: I’m not sure that’s possible. There are hundreds of them across a huge number of files.

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: I’m finding the same thing, there doesn’t seem to be any malicious pattern to it either. They reference Jira issues that this account is assigned to, and they appear to fix the issues that they are associated with.

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: They’ve gone through a weird amount of effort too. A lot of comments on these issues are spoofed from our accounts. Also their comments and reviews appear on closed pr’s.

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: Could they have force pushed branches to rewrite their commit history?

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: Yes, but I don’t know how they inserted historical comments in pr’s and such in github

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: Who keeps their laptop in the office overnight, and what permissions do you have in the repo?

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: I don’t.

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: I don’t think anyone doesn’t take their laptop home

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Triggered #6481 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: John Lovington Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Acknowledged #6481 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: John Lovington Service: Monolith

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: Should I stop my virus scan to look at the queue?

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: Keep scanning, you can use my computer to log in, I’m finished

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Resolved #6481 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: John Lovington Service: Monolith

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: @ajay can you take a look at the graderite-social for bgutenberg?

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: Did anyone modify the virtualenv on next recently?

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: false alarm

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Triggered #6482 | ALARM: "new-worker queue jump above 250,000 messages" in US East (N. Virginia) Assigned: John Lovington Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Escalated #6482 | ALARM: "new-worker queue jump above 250,000 messages" in US East (N. Virginia) Assigned: Anna Chan Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Acknowledged #6482 | ALARM: "new-worker queue jump above 250,000 messages" in US East (N. Virginia) Assigned: Anna Chan Service: Monolith

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: I’ll just wait and see if it goes back down

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Resolved #6482 | ALARM: "new-worker queue jump above 250,000 messages" in US East (N. Virginia) Assigned: Anna Chan Service: Monolith

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: I finished up the audits on my repos this weekend. I found changes by bgutenberg all the way through, but nothing appears suspicious in the changes

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: Me too, nothing so suspicious here, besides some bad coding practices. Exploits however, I found none of

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: What sort of bad coding practices?

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: One of the DALs wasn’t using the connection pool, but I don’t think this could be used to hurt us unless someone really hammered the server with requests for notifications or something

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: How soon do you think you could have a patch in for that?

engineering.author: John
engineering.text: This afternoon I could get it into code review

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: @here look through the repos again for any more commits from unknowns, there may be some from someone named christy

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: How many guru cards show touched by these two? Is there a history tool we can use to revert these to a previous state?

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: Not many by brad, but a lot by christy. There is a tool, but it shows edits for a long time back done by them. It seems like theyve been editing cards on the down low for a long time and we never noticed

engineering.author: David
engineering.text: Could it be that they were hacked like google and github?

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: it just seems too farfetched for guru too

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: what’s the overall plan with tasks now. Are we still doing things in order?

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: I would say yes, keep on working on your assigned tasks until we find out what restructuring we have to do

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: Even for tasks assigned by brad?

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: not those…

engineering.author: Ajay
engineering.text: @anna would you be able to give me some tasks, I’m fresh out

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Triggered #6483 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: John Lovington Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Resolved #6483 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: John Lovington Service: Monolith

engineering.author: Anna
engineering.text: I resolved and reassigned. @david is pagerduty affected now too? I don’t think john lovington works here

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Triggered #6484 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: Anna Chan Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Escalated #6484 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: David Castillo Service: Monolith

engineering.author: PagerDuty
engineering.text: Escalated #6484 | Problem | Disaster | Average ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold 200000.0 for QueueName graderite-social-tasks Assigned: David Castillo Service: Monolith

john-christy.author: John
john-christy.text: Want to get lunch?

john-christy.author: Christy
john-christy.text: I’m on this call with the building manager, no lunch today.

john-christy.author: John
john-christy.text: :sadpanda:

john-christy.author: Christy
john-christy.text: You’ve got to chill out about the sink.

john-christy.author: Christy
john-christy.text: Want to go out for lunch today?

john-christy.author: John
john-christy.text: Sure!

john-christy.author: Christy
john-christy.text: Lets go at 12:30 after I handle the caterer

john-christy.author: John
john-christy.text: SGTM! :heart:

john-christy.author: Christy
john-christy.text: You could _not_ be an asshole

john-christy.author: Christy
john-christy.text: Do you want to go up to Erie this weekend?

john-christy.author: John
john-christy.text: Don’t you have to officiate that company axe throwing thing?

john-christy.author: Christy
john-christy.text: I don’t have to be there for that.

john-christy.author: John
john-christy.text: Sure!

john-christy.author: John
john-christy.text: I don’t want to freak you out, but brad has a seat in the chart, and his seat is full of real life stuff

john-christy.author: Christy
john-christy.text: I’ve already told David, I noticed it this morning. Please don’t tell anyone else, we are getting the locks changed monday

john-christy.author: John
john-christy.text: I think people already know, I’ve seen people eye the desk surreptitiously as they walk by

john-christy.author: Christy
john-christy.text: Oh man

john-christy.author: Christy
john-christy.text: Would you like to go camping instead this weekend?

john-christy.author: John
john-christy.text: Sure, why?

john-christy.author: Christy
john-christy.text: Lets talk after work

christy-david.author: David
christy-david.text: Throw our weight at the manager, we need this fixed today.

christy-david.author: Christy
christy-david.text: He literally can’t send anyone out until monday.

christy-david.author: David
christy-david.text: Get an independent technician

christy-david.author: Christy
christy-david.text: I’ve already looked into it, the contract says that only their technicians can do the work.

christy-david.author: David
christy-david.text: This noise has got to stop.

christy-david.author: Christy
christy-david.text: I’ll find out if it can get any quieter.

christy-david.author: Christy
christy-david.text: The axe throwing place won’t give us the group rate for under 20 people

christy-david.author: David
christy-david.text: That’s unacceptable, find another place

christy-david.author: Christy
christy-david.text: I’m not sure there _are_ any other axe throwing places

christy-david.author: David
christy-david.text: Book escape the room this weekend instead

christy-david.author: Christy
christy-david.text: I already booked the axe place

christy-david.author: David
christy-david.text: How sure are we that this isn’t just a glitch?

christy-david.author: Christy
christy-david.text: I’m seeing extensive edits done to our guru cards by this person

christy-david.author: David
christy-david.text: Can we revert those changes?

christy-david.author: Christy
christy-david.text: I have no idea

christy-david.author: David
christy-david.text: Set up a meeting tomorrow morning with everyone on the dream team for this hacking thing

christy-david.author: Christy
christy-david.text: Done

christy-david.author: Christy
christy-david.text: It looks like someone’s broken into the office. The seating chart has been changed so that the remote seat at the front is listed as brad’s, and there’s a lot of stuff on the desk that wasn’t there before.

christy-david.author: David
christy-david.text: WHY WHY WHY???? What’s on the desk?

christy-david.author: Christy
christy-david.text: I don’t know, nothing weird. Programming books and stuff, it just looks like a normal desk, but the remote desks are supposed to be clean except for a monitor and a couple other things. There’s way more stuff than that here.

christy-david.author: David
christy-david.text: Get a locksmith in here and change all the locks. We need to start physically locking the glass door, I don’t trust this magnetic lock

christy-david.author: Christy
christy-david.text: I’m already on the phone to the landlord

christy-david.author: David
christy-david.text: check your records, the ip they could steal is way more valuable than whatever half baked plan is going on here

john-david.author: John
john-david.text: I think christie might have actually worked here as our office manager

john-david.author: John
john-david.text: I think as recently as this week

john-david.author: John
john-david.text: there was a lot of stuff in my apartment that I don’t remember getting. More than a few things had christie’s name on it

john-david.author: John
john-david.text: but maybe the weirdest thing is that I found a lot of slack messages between me and her, and some of them talked about us going hiking together last weekend

john-david.author: David
john-david.text: But you didn’t go hiking last weekend?

john-david.author: John
john-david.text: no, but i DID go to Allegheny National Forest, I didn’t tell anyone though. I was going to hike, but I didn’t feel into it and I left after a bit.

john-david.author: John
john-david.text: I did a search for that place in slack though, and I found a message from brad saying that he was going there two weekends ago. I don’t remember him, and I don’t remember her, but I can’t explain why I was there. I don’t even like hiking

john-david.author: John
john-david.text: I think christie and I went there to look for brad, and I think we were living together too.

john-david.author: David
john-david.text: Lets talk in the meeting room
